meanings.definition: A person or thing that vanishes.
meanings.sent1: The magician's assistant was one of the vanishers in the show.
meanings.sent2: The detective searched for clues left behind by the vanishers.
meanings.sent3: The vanishers at the magic show always amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The mist in the forest acted like invisible vanishers, hiding everything within.
meanings.sent5: The legend spoke of ancient vanishers who could disappear at will.

meanings.definition: A substance used to make something disappear.
meanings.sent1: The special spray was the vanishers used by the spy to hide secrets.
meanings.sent2: The vanishers applied to the painting made it invisible to the eye.
meanings.sent3: The vanishers in the bottle were so powerful, they could make objects vanish instantly.
meanings.sent4: The potion acted like a magical vanisher, making the treasure disappear from sight.
meanings.sent5: The vanishers in the formula were so potent, they could erase any trace of the crime.

meanings.definition: The act of disappearing suddenly or completely.
meanings.sent1: The vanishing of the sun behind the clouds signaled the start of evening.
meanings.sent2: The vanishing of the ship on the horizon puzzled the onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The vanishing of the cake from the kitchen left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent4: The vanishing of the stars at dawn marked the arrival of daylight.
meanings.sent5: The vanishing of the ghostly figure in the mirror startled the young girl.
